article.para: The Kernel Dump Configuration provides a graphical user interface (GUI) to configure the kernel dump
You must be running the X Window System and have root privileges to use the Kernel Dump Configuration. There are two ways to start the application:

listitem.para: From the desktop, go to the main menu on the panel (the menu with the "f" icon)SystemAdministrationKdump
Type the command system-config-kdump at a shell prompt (for example, in an XTerm or a GNOME terminal).

section.title: Basic Controls
section.para: After instalation Kernel Dump Configuration is kdump disabled. And you cannot change any settings.
To enable kdump click on Enable button.

section.title: Basic Settings
section.para:
In Basic Settings you can see these items:
Total System Memory — Shows allover memory in your system.
Current kdump Memory — Shows actual memory reserved for kdump.
New kdump Memory — Shows new memory you wish to reserve for kdump. Beside is spin button allowing you to change this amount.
Usable Memory — Shows usable memory of system after applying your changes.
